info.name: Collateral eminence
info.description: The collateral eminence is an elongated swelling within the floor of the inferior horn of the lateral ventricle lying between with the hippocampus and calcar avis.  It is caused by the indentation of the collateral fissure into the ventricle from the outside surface of the brain.
info.item: /Sections/Thick, Whole Brain/Coronal/ Frontal to Occipital/9 Cor: Fr to Occ
